case: 
Twelve Waris Dirie lives in a village in the desert nomads in Somalia. When he realizes that her father has decided to marry a seventy year old shepherd runs away from home and goes to the capital Mogadishu to her grandmother. But she, embarrassed by the behavior of his granddaughter, she keeps it close but sends enclosed to work as a cleaner at the Embassy of Somalia in London, near some relatives. For the next few years the young Waris living in captivity inside the embassy until the day breaks civil home and all officials fleeing. Suddenly found wandering alone with a suitcase with very little belongings, for the first time on the streets of London. She finds a job as a cleaner in a restaurant, but soon fate would smile when he pulls the attention of a famous photographer Terry Donaldson. Since that time and with the help of good friend Marylin, her life would change forever ... The true story of Waris Dirie's first great fashion models from Africa, but hid inside of a horrible story. In an interview with the famous journalist Barbara Walters of NBC, the Waris revealed that at the age of five years fell victim to the cruel ritual of female genital mutilation. In 1997 the biography of 'Desert Flower'. The book received huge success, translated into fifty different languages and has sold more than eleven million copies worldwide.
